title: Deploy the suite on BYOK
content:
This section provides information required to install and configure the suite on BYOK platforms, including the preparation, installation, and setup tasks.

Before you begin, ensure that you have the deployment architecture planned and have the servers allocated as the bastion node and worker nodes. 

The following table provides a list of tasks that you must complete in the given order. A user can have multiple roles.

Install OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT)

If you wish to use any OMT services in any stage in your deployment, you need to a first install OMT.

Skip this step if you don't require OMT for your deployment, and you need to enable the OMT Tools capability on your bastion node. See Enable the Tools capability on a new bastion node.

The link in the table takes you to the OMT documentation. In the OMT documentation, follow the steps required for external Kubernetes only. After completing the OMT installation, return to this page to install the suite.

The OMT documentation contains information related to other deployment and is not specific to the suite. Note the following while using the document.

  1. When considering the specifications for OMT installation, make sure you align it with the sepcification for suite installation on BYOK. For suite specifications, see Support matrix  and Sizing consideration.
  2. For information relating to Kubernetes, only apply steps for BYOK.
  3. When preparing the external database, skip the option for Oracle database and ipv6 as they are currently not supported by the suite.
  4. When completing the OMT post-upgrade tasks, skip the task to configure a load balancer. You will perform this task using suite-specific steps provided when installing the suite.
Task Where to perform Role How to perform
Install OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT). First control plane node Suite administrator Install OMT (embedded K8s).

Prepare

Complete these preparation tasks before installing the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1

Prepare external PostgreSQL databases for OMT and the suite.

 Database server Database administrator The procedure to prepare external databases on any BYOK deployment is the same as preparing for OpenShift. For details on preparing on OpenShift see Prepare external databases.
2 Download the suite chart package. Bastion node Suite administrator Download the installation packages.
3 Download the suite images and transfer them to a registry Bastion node Suite administrator Upload images to a registry.
4 If you wish to use a static persistent volume, create NFS volumes for the suite NFS server Storage administrator Configure NFS volumes.
5

Create namespaces for the suite.

 Bastion node Suite administrator Create namespaces for the suite.
6

Prepare persistent volumes for ESM

 NFS server Storage administrator Prepare persistent volumes for ESM.

Install the suite

Complete these tasks to install the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1 Perform pre-installation checks Bastion node  Suite administrator Perform pre-installation checks.
2

Install the suite using CLI.

To install using CLI, you'll have to first Create my-values.yaml.

 Bastion node Suite administrator

Install ESM using CLI.
Install the suite using AppHub AppHub Installation portal Suite administrator Install ESM using AppHub.
3 Configure a load balancer. BYOK console Suite administrator For OpenShift, see Configure a load balancer.

For GCP, see Configure external application load balancer.
4 Verify the installation. Bastion node Suite administrator Verify ESM installation.
5 Perform database-related and tuning tasks after installation. Database server and bastion node Database administrator and suite administrator Post-installation tasks.

Set up tenants

After installing the suite, perform the following initial setup tasks to use the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1

Tasks for suite administrators to perform in Suite Administration.

 Suite Administration Suite administrator Tenant setup tasks for suite administrators.
2

Tasks for tenant administrators to perform in Service Management.

 Service Management Tenant administrators Tenant setup tasks for tenant administrators

Install add-on capabilities

Skip this section if you don't want to install add-on capabilities or if you've already installed them during the suite installation.

Install add-on capabilities on top of an existing suite if you didn't select them from the installation portal when deploying the suite. 

Task Where to perform Role How to perform

Install the CMP FinOps, Hybrid Cloud Management, Service Portal for Service Manager and Software Asset Management (SAM) capabilities on top of an existing suite.

 OMT Management Portal Suite administrator Install add-on capabilities.

Configure add-on capabilities

Skip this section if you don't want to install add-on capabilities.

Configure and enable add-on capabilities if you've installed them during or after the suite installation.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1

Enable the SAM capability.

 Suite Administration Suite administrator and tenant administrator Enable SAM.
2

Enable the Hybrid Cloud Management capability.

 Suite Administration and Service Management Suite administrator and tenant administrator Enable DND.
3

Enable the CMP FinOps capability.

 Suite Administration and Service Management Suite administrator and tenant administrator Enable CMP FinOps.

Enable Native SACM

Skip this section if you don't want to use the Native SACM solution.

Configure and enable Native SACM after the suite deployment.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1

Enable Native SACM by using the UCMDB Gateway.

 Suite Administration Suite administrator Enable Native SACM.
